mainHero.title: Greater Vancouver
mainHero.subtitle: Ping Pong Society.
mainHero.description: Brand new training Facility, Open to everyone Daily.

items.title: Play casualy with Friends
items.description: The Facility is open to leisure play for anyone to enjoy with their friends or meet new players and grow your skills together.

items.title: Train with coaches
items.description: Train competitively with our CTTA Approved Coaches, they can improve your game in all manners from mental to physical table tennis skills.

features.title: Latest & greatest
features.subtitle: All the best and latest equipment available!
features.description: We have been using the recent and latest equipment in table tennis from balls, tables and rackets.

items.name: Table Tennis Ball (40mm)
items.description: The international rules specify that the game is played with a sphere having a mass of 2.7 grams (0.095 oz) and a diameter of 40 millimetres (1.57 in).

items.name: Tables
items.description: The table is 2.74 m (9.0 ft) long, 1.525 m (5.0 ft) wide, and 76 cm (2.5 ft) high with any continuous material so long as the table yields a uniform bounce of about 23 cm (9.1 in) when a standard ball is dropped onto it from a height of 30 cm (11.8 in), or about 77%.

items.name: Rackets
items.description: Players are equipped with a laminated wooden racket covered with rubber on one or two sides depending on the grip of the player. The ITTF uses the term “racket”, though “bat” is common in Britain, and “paddle” in the U.S. and Canada.
